PublishToMavenRepository does not cover PublishToMavenLocal. Should we use AbstractPublishToMaven type instead?
https://docs.gradle.org/current/javadoc/org/gradle/api/publish/maven/tasks/AbstractPublishToMaven.html

I actually want PublishToMavenLocal to work for local testing. This is just meant to highlight the fact that we can generate all artifacts from a single architecture (e.g. just a jar and a script for windows). It could be removed but the hope is that it helps clarify expectations.
Could you please elaborate why this is necessary? Does it cause issues with the test if windows has different default value here?

yes, tests which expect connection failures to trigger retries and ultimately failures on my windows installation were taking 2 seconds to fail each connection attempt. This often lead to test timeouts when we do 5 retries and have a 10 second test timeout.
I tested with the \n but yes let me change to \r\n.
Consider creating an issue, otherwise it's hard to track.
I'll just ignore this test for now...

What is the expected output for linux and osx classifiers? After running it locally, in servicetalk-grpc-protoc/build/buildExecutable folder I see only:

protoc-gen-servicetalk_grpc.sh
servicetalk-grpc-protoc-0.26.0-SNAPSHOT-all.jar
Should I see any files with classifiers?

Weird, in servicetalk-grpc-protoc/build/buildExecutable I see only protoc-gen-servicetalk_grpc.sh. But when I do ./gradlew publishToMavenLocal` then I see that it publishes two scripts:

servicetalk-grpc-protoc-0.26.0-SNAPSHOT-linux-x86_64.sh
servicetalk-grpc-protoc-0.26.0-SNAPSHOT-osx-x86_64.sh
But their content is identical. I think we may have only one .sh script.
Tested with the mavenLocal, looks like os-classifier is necessary and we need to have separate scripts for all platforms.

yes for local development/builds we use a single script targeted at the current platform in servicetalk-grpc-protoc/build/buildExecutable. However for maven we publish both scripts with classifiers to disambiguate and this is also what the grpc-gradle-plugin expects too.
